channel.title: CyberNetSec - Ransomware
channel.description: Latest ransomware threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Claims Breach of Tulsa International Airport, Leaks Data
item.description:
The Russian-affiliated Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Tulsa International Airport. The group has listed the airport on its data leak site, alleging the theft of sensitive data including financial records and employee information. While airport operations ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Canada Computers Discloses Data Breach Affecting Guest Checkout Customers
item.description:
Canada Computers Inc., a major Canadian electronics retailer, has announced a data breach that exposed the personal and credit card information of customers. The incident affected individuals who used the 'guest' checkout feature on the company's website between December 29, 2025, and January 22, 20...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Play Ransomware Hits US Instrument Manufacturer Deatak in Data Breach
item.description:
The Play ransomware group has claimed another victim in the manufacturing sector, listing U.S.-based instrument maker Deatak on its data breach forum. The attackers allege they have compromised and exfiltrated a wide range of private and confidential data, including client documents, employee payrol...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: INC Ransomware Group Breaches Two U.S. Law Firms, Leaks Sensitive Client Data
item.description:
The INC ransomware group is actively targeting the U.S. legal sector, claiming responsibility for attacks on at least two law firms: Hawk Law Group and Eisenberg Lowrance Lundell Lofgren. The group alleges it has stolen highly sensitive client information, including data related to civil and crimina...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attack Cripples City of New Britain, CT, Forcing Manual Operations
item.description:
A ransomware attack has caused significant and ongoing disruption to the municipal network systems of New Britain, Connecticut. The attack, which began last week and was later confirmed as ransomware, has impacted the city's entire internet server. As a result, city departments have been forced to a...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Incident Response

item.title: FCC Warns Telecoms of 4x Increase in Ransomware, Urges Better Security
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has issued a formal alert to the telecommunications industry regarding the escalating threat of ransomware. Citing data that shows a fourfold increase in attacks on the sector between 2022 and 2025, the FCC's Public Safety and Homeland Security Bureau...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Ransomware

item.title: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026
item.description:
The Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Health-ISAC) has released its 2026 Global Health Sector Threat Landscape report, identifying AI-enabled attacks as the number one projected concern for the year. Based on surveys of healthcare executives and security professionals, the report highl...

Severity: Informational

item.title: FBI Shuts Down RAMP, a Notorious Ransomware Recruitment and Trading Hub
item.description:
In a significant blow to the ransomware ecosystem, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has seized the RAMP (Russian Anonymous MarketPlace) forum. The Russian-language site, which operated on both the clear and dark web, was a central hub for ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operations. It s...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Sicarii Ransomware' RaaS Emerges, Targeting U.S. Manufacturing
item.description:
A new ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation named 'Sicarii Ransomware' has been discovered by researchers at CYFIRMA. Active since late 2025, the group is targeting the manufacturing sector in the United States. The malware encrypts victim files using AES-GCM and appends a '.sicarii' extension to...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: AI-Fueled Cyberattacks Surge by 70%, Check Point's 2026 Report Reveals
item.description:
Check Point's 14th annual Cyber Security Report highlights a dramatic escalation in the global threat landscape, revealing a 70% increase in cyberattacks since 2023. The 2026 report, analyzing trends from 2025, found that organizations faced an average of 1,968 attacks per week. A primary driver of ...

Severity: Informational
